item.title: Hackers Stole $1.49 Billion in Cryptocurrency to Date in 2024
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Hackers have caused close to $1.49 billion in cryptocurrency losses this year, with $71 million worth of assets stolen in November.

The post Hackers Stole $1.49 Billion in Cryptocurrency to Date in 2024 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of December 2, 2024 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of December 2, 2024. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: Energy Sector Contractor ENGlobal Targeted in Ransomware Attack
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Energy sector contractor ENGlobal Corporation has restricted access to some of its systems in response to a ransomware attack.

The post Energy Sector Contractor ENGlobal Targeted in Ransomware Attack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cisco Warns of Attacks Exploiting Decade-Old ASA Vulnerability
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Cisco has updated an advisory for CVE-2014-2120 to warn customers that the vulnerability has been exploited in the wild. 

The post Cisco Warns of Attacks Exploiting Decade-Old ASA Vulnerability appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: AWS Launches Incident Response Service
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
AWS has launched Security Incident Response, a new service for quick and efficient security event management.

The post AWS Launches Incident Response Service appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Prototype UEFI Bootkit is South Korean University Project; LogoFAIL Exploit Discovered
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
The 'Bootkitty' prototype UEFI bootkit contains an exploit for LogoFAIL and was created in a South Korea university program.

The post Prototype UEFI Bootkit is South Korean University Project; LogoFAIL Exploit Discovered appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cybersecurity M&A Roundup: 49 Deals Announced in November 2024
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Roundup of the forty-nine cybersecurity-related merger and acquisition (M&A) deals announced in November 2024.

The post Cybersecurity M&A Roundup: 49 Deals Announced in November 2024 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Critical Vulnerability Found in Zabbix Network Monitoring Tool
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
A critical-severity vulnerability in open source enterprise network monitoring tool Zabbix could lead to full system compromise.

The post Critical Vulnerability Found in Zabbix Network Monitoring Tool appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Two UK Hospitals Hit by Cyberattacks, One Postponed Procedures
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Alder Hey Children’s Hospital and Wirral University Teaching Hospital have fallen victim to cyberattacks, including one involving ransomware.

The post Two UK Hospitals Hit by Cyberattacks, One Postponed Procedures appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Russian Hacker With $10 Million Bounty on His Head Reportedly Arrested
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Russian authorities have reportedly arrested Mikhail Matveev, who is wanted by the US for ransomware attacks against critical infrastructure.

The post Russian Hacker With $10 Million Bounty on His Head Reportedly Arrested appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: In Other News: OPPC Breach Impacts 1.7M, US Soldier Suspected in Snowflake Hack, Cloudflare Loses Logs
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: OnePoint Patient Care data breach impact doubles, a US soldier may have been involved in the Snowflake hack, Cloudflare lost customer logs.

The post In Other News: OPPC Breach Impacts 1.7M, US Soldier Suspected in Snowflake Hack, Cloudflare Loses Logs appeared first on SecurityWeek.
